meta.title: Operation of High Performance Liquid Chromatography

sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation and maintenance of High Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) for qualitative and quantitative analysis of pharmaceutical compounds.
sections.scope: Applicable to liquid chromatography activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Verify that all mobile phase bottles contain sufficient volume of filtered and degassed solvents.
Check that the waste container is empty and all tubing connections are secure and leak-free.
Power ON the HPLC system including pump, detector, column oven, and data acquisition system.
Allow the system to stabilize and reach the desired temperature for at least 15-30 minutes.
Prime the pump with mobile phase to remove air bubbles from the system.
Set the flow rate, column temperature, detection wavelength, and other parameters as per analytical method.
Install the appropriate analytical column and equilibrate with mobile phase until baseline stabilizes.
Prepare sample and standard solutions according to the validated analytical method.
Inject blank solution to verify system suitability and baseline stability.
Inject standard solutions followed by sample solutions using autosampler or manual injection.
Monitor the chromatogram during analysis and ensure proper peak shape and retention times.
After analysis completion, flush the column with appropriate solvent to remove residual sample components.
Record and save all chromatographic data with proper identification and documentation.
Return flow rate to storage conditions and power OFF the system following proper shutdown sequence.
Clean the injection port and document instrument usage in the logbook.
precautions: Always use HPLC grade solvents that are properly filtered and degassed.
Never allow the pump to run dry as it may damage the system.
Ensure samples are filtered before injection to prevent column blockage.
Do not exceed the maximum pressure limit of the column.
Wear appropriate personal protective equipment including lab coat, gloves, and safety goggles.
Dispose of chemical waste as per institutional guidelines.
Perform regular maintenance and calibration as per manufacturer recommendations.
